Class TCPPacket

java.lang.Object

All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class TCPPacket
extends IPPacket
implements java.io.Serializable

A bean class that provides access to TCP packet data.

Constructor Detail

TCPPacket

protected TCPPacket(long seconds,
                    long microSeconds,
                    int len,
                    int datalinkHdrLen,
                    byte[] data)
Creates a new instance of the TCPPacket class using the specified parameters.

Parameters:
seconds - The number of seconds for the TCP packet.
microSeconds - The number of microseconds for the TCP packet.
len - The length of the data portion of the TCP packet (in bytes).
datalinkHdrLen - The length of the header portion of the TCP packet (in bytes).
data - An array of bytes that is the data portion of the TCP packet.
Method Detail

getDataOffset

public int getDataOffset()
Description copied from class: Packet
Returns the offset into the data array where the payload of the packet starts. Subclasses should override this to give proper data offset excluding enclosed headers.

Overrides:
getDataOffset in class IPPacket
Returns:
The offset within the data array of the packet data excluding the header information.
See Also:
IPPacket.getDataOffset()

getPayloadLen

public int getPayloadLen()
Description copied from class: Packet
Returns the length of the data portion of the packet. Subclasses should override this method to identify their specific payload.

Overrides:
getPayloadLen in class IPPacket
Returns:
The payload length.
See Also:
IPPacket.getPayloadLen()

isURG

public boolean isURG()
Gets the Urgent (URG) flag that prioritizes certain data in a packet segment.

Returns:
true if prioritize are set with in the packet else it is false.

isACK

public boolean isACK()
Gets the Acknowledge Flag.

Returns:
A boolean value that is "true" if data is prioritized within the packet, and is "false" otherwise.

isPSH

public boolean isPSH()
Gets the PSH flag. The PSH flag in the TCP header, informs the receiving host that the data should be pushed up to the receiving application immediately.

Returns:
A boolean value that is "true" if the data should be pushed to the receiving application immediately, and is "false" if a push is not required.

isRST

public boolean isRST()
Gets the RST flag. The RST flag indicates whether a connection should be aborted in response to an error.

Returns:
A boolean value that is "true" if the connection should be closed in response to an error, and is false if it should not.

isSYN

public boolean isSYN()
Gets a flag that indicates whether a connection should be initiated.

Returns:
A boolean value that is true if a connection should be initiated, and is "false" if a connection won't be initiated.

isFIN

public boolean isFIN()
Gets the FIN Flag.

Returns:
A boolean value that is "true" if the connection should be closed, and is "false" if the connection should remain the same.

getWindow

public int getWindow()
Gets the window.

Returns:
An int value that is the window.

getUrgentPointer

public short getUrgentPointer()
Gets the urgent pointer that indicates priority data.

Returns:
A short value that is the urgent pointer.
